```{r setup}
library(seecolor)
library(ggplot2)
```

## Use `print_color` to print color literals, palettes and ggplot2 objects.

```{r}
print_color(c("red", "navy", "#521354"))

print_color(palette())

print_color(colors(), blank.len = 1)


p1 <- ggplot(iris) + 
  geom_point(aes(Sepal.Length, Petal.Length, color = Species))

print_color(p1)

p2 <- ggplot(iris) + 
  geom_point(aes(Sepal.Length, Petal.Length, color = Sepal.Width))

print_color(p2)
```
